attributes.action: Make it illegal to park in parent/child bays if you do not have a child with you
attributes.additional_details:
There has been many incidents where I have not been able to park in a parent/child bay and that extra space is essential, especially with an infant. Trying to get them out of a car seat and then into their buggy requires extra room.
I've had men in vans park in these bays, as well as an OAP couple (without a DB), which left me with a standard car bay, struggling to get my 6 month old baby out of the car, without damaging the car next to me.
Every parent I have spoken with feel the same.
attributes.background:
It should be illegal to park in a parent/child bay if you do not have a child, under the age of 12 with you.

Just like disability parking, parents should be issued with a badge, establishing the child they are with. If no child is present they should be issued with a penalty charge.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/628573

We have also published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Regulate parent and child parking spaces: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/631832
